creator: sam@redspr.com
text:
The configuration directive:
<Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.AccessLogValve"
directory="/var/www" ...

Will log in '/var/www' on Unix but '$TOMCAT_HOME/var/www' on Win32. 

Im note sure what the ideal behaviour is but as now it seems 
inconsistent. My vote would be for the configuration files to use
Unix style path/seperator.

Thanks

Sam

creator: funkman@joedog.org
text:
AccessLogValve asks the JVM is the path provided is absolute. (via
File.isAbsolute()) 

For windows - to be absolute you need to also specify the drive name. So in windows:
/var is not absolute but c:/var is.
